populations.name: Private Sector Rivals
populations.description: Private companies or entities that may face increased competition or resource diversion due to federal investments or partnerships favoring select businesses.

populations.name: Federal Employees
populations.description: Workers employed by the federal government across all departments and agencies.

populations.name: Scientific Researchers
populations.description: Scientists and researchers working in academic, government, or private sector laboratories and research institutions.

populations.name: Tech Industry
populations.description: Companies, workers, and entrepreneurs in the technology sector, including software, hardware, and digital services.

populations.name: Academic Institutions
populations.description: Universities, colleges, and other educational institutions involved in teaching, research, and knowledge dissemination.

populations.name: Regional Stability Actors
populations.description: Governments, security forces, and partners in the Middle East who benefit from actions enhancing regional security and stability.

populations.name: Muslim Americans
populations.description: Members of the Muslim American community who may face increased scrutiny or stigmatization due to the association of the order with Islamist groups.

populations.name: Civilian Populations In Designated Countries
populations.description: General populations in Lebanon, Jordan, and Egypt who might be indirectly affected by heightened security measures or retaliatory actions.

populations.name: Brazil
populations.description: The population and industries within Brazil affected positively by tariff removals and trade negotiations.

populations.name: Agricultural Workers
populations.description: Workers in the U.S. agricultural sector who could be negatively impacted by increased competition due to tariff removals on Brazilian agricultural products.

populations.name: Children In Foster Care
populations.description: Children and youth who are currently placed in foster care or transitioning out of it.

populations.name: Foster Families
populations.description: Families and caregivers involved in providing foster care to children in need.

populations.name: Faith Based Organizations
populations.description: Religious institutions and faith-based groups involved in child welfare and foster care programs.

populations.name: Children Protected By Nondiscrimination Policies
populations.description: Children who might be indirectly affected if protections against discrimination (sexual orientation, gender identity, etc.) are weakened by permitting caregiver exclusions based on sincerely-held religious beliefs.

populations.name: State Child Welfare Agencies
populations.description: State agencies that may face challenges or controversies in changing policies or implementing federal directives accommodating religious exemptions.

populations.name: China
populations.description: The population and industries within China affected by trade policies and economic agreements with the United States.

populations.name: Manufacturing Workers
populations.description: Workers employed in manufacturing sectors potentially strengthened by improved trade relations and supply chain security.

populations.name: Displaced Federal Workers
populations.description: Federal employees who may face job elimination or increased difficulty in being rehired due to reductions and strict hiring controls.

populations.name: Qatari Government And Security Forces
populations.description: The government and security personnel of the State of Qatar who will benefit from U.S. security guarantees and cooperation.

populations.name: High Net Worth Immigrants
populations.description: Immigrants who are able to make significant financial contributions or investments to qualify for expedited visas.

populations.name: Investment Entities
populations.description: Corporations or similar organizations that sponsor or make financial gifts on behalf of individuals applying for the Gold Card visa.

populations.name: Non Investor Immigrants
populations.description: Immigrants who do not have the means to make large financial contributions and may face longer or more difficult visa processes as a result.

populations.name: Low Income Immigrants
populations.description: Immigrant populations who cannot access this program due to financial restrictions, potentially limiting equitable access to immigration benefits.

populations.name: Undocumented Immigrants
populations.description: Individuals residing in the United States without legal immigration status or authorization.

populations.name: Railroad Employees
populations.description: Employees working in the railroad industry, including those represented by various labor unions involved in disputes.

populations.name: Labor Union Members
populations.description: Workers who are members of labor organizations representing their collective interests during disputes.

populations.name: Wrongfully Detained Us Nationals
populations.description: U.S. citizens and nationals who are subjected to unlawful or wrongful detention abroad.

populations.name: Populations In Designated Countries
populations.description: Civilian populations in countries designated as State Sponsors of Wrongful Detention who may face economic, political, or social repercussions from U.S. sanctions and restrictions.

populations.name: Architectural Professionals
populations.description: Architects and design professionals specializing in classical and traditional architecture who may benefit from increased demand and recognition under this order.

populations.name: Modernist Architectural Practitioners
populations.description: Architects and firms specializing in modernist, brutalist, or deconstructivist styles who could face reduced opportunities and preference under the new federal guidelines.

populations.name: Pretrial Defendants
populations.description: Individuals awaiting trial who may be affected by changes to bail policies, particularly those unable to afford bail.

populations.name: Patriotic Citizens
populations.description: U.S. citizens and residents who value and support legal protections for national symbols.

populations.name: Protestors
populations.description: Individuals who engage in acts of flag desecration as a form of political expression and may face legal consequences.

populations.name: Foreign Nationals Engaged In Desecration
populations.description: Non-citizens who participate in American flag burning and may be subject to immigration penalties including visa denial or removal.

populations.name: Government Service Users
populations.description: General public who use federal government digital and physical services and will benefit from improved design and usability.

populations.name: Design Professionals
populations.description: Creative professionals such as graphic designers, UX/UI specialists, and architects who may gain federal employment or contracting opportunities through this initiative.

populations.name: Federal Agencies
populations.description: Departments, bureaus, and offices of the federal government responsible for implementing laws and policies.

populations.name: Pharmaceutical Manufacturers
populations.description: Companies involved in producing active pharmaceutical ingredients and finished drug products benefiting from increased domestic procurement and stockpiling.

populations.name: Commercial Space Operators
populations.description: Private companies and entities involved in commercial space launch, reentry, and novel space missions who will benefit from streamlined regulations and increased market opportunities.

populations.name: Environmental Advocates
populations.description: Individuals and groups concerned that expedited regulatory and environmental reviews may reduce protections against possible environmental impacts from increased space launch and spaceport infrastructure development.

populations.name: Bank Customers
populations.description: Individuals and businesses who use banking and financial services and benefit from access free of political or religious discrimination.

populations.name: Small Business Owners
populations.description: Owners and operators of small businesses who rely on fair access to financial services and SBA programs.

populations.name: Financial Institutions
populations.description: Banks, credit unions, and other financial service providers who may face increased compliance burdens and scrutiny, and lose discretion in managing reputational risk.

populations.name: Bank Regulators
populations.description: Federal banking regulatory agencies whose supervisory tools and guidance are restricted or altered, potentially limiting their enforcement discretion.

populations.name: Defined Contribution Plan Participants
populations.description: Individuals who participate in 401(k) and other employer-sponsored defined-contribution retirement plans, benefiting from expanded investment options.

populations.name: Retirement Plan Beneficiaries At Risk
populations.description: Participants in defined-contribution plans who could face higher investment risks or losses due to exposure to less liquid or more complex alternative assets.

populations.name: Fiduciaries Facing Litigation Risk
populations.description: Plan fiduciaries who may encounter increased scrutiny and potential lawsuits when offering alternative asset investments to plan participants.

populations.name: India
populations.description: The population and industries within India affected by tariffs and trade restrictions imposed due to their importation of Russian Federation oil.

populations.name: American Youth
populations.description: Children and adolescents in the United States who will benefit from increased access to fitness programs, sports participation, and nutrition initiatives.

populations.name: Education Administrators
populations.description: School and education system leaders involved in implementing fitness testing and nutrition programs.

populations.name: Small Importers
populations.description: Businesses and individuals who rely on duty-free de minimis shipments and may face higher costs or administrative burdens due to new tariffs and duty payments.

populations.name: International Shippers
populations.description: Companies and carriers involved in international shipping and postal delivery who will face new duty collection processes and bonding requirements.

populations.name: Collegiate Athletes
populations.description: Student-athletes participating in college sports who benefit from scholarships, protections, and expanded opportunities under this order.

populations.name: Donor Supported Collegiate Programs
populations.description: Collegiate athletic programs and donors who may face increased restrictions or loss of influence in paying athletes or controlling recruitment under the new policies.

populations.name: Homeless Individuals
populations.description: People experiencing homelessness who may benefit from increased access to treatment and housing under new civil commitment and support programs.

populations.name: Substance Use Disorder Affected Populations
populations.description: Individuals with substance use disorders potentially impacted negatively by restrictions on harm reduction programs and increased law enforcement.

populations.name: Housing First Advocates
populations.description: Organizations and individuals supporting harm reduction and housing-first models who may lose federal funding and face increased opposition.

populations.name: Developers Of Ideologically Inclusive Ai
populations.description: AI developers and vendors whose models incorporate DEI features may face exclusion from federal contracts due to the order's prohibitions.

populations.name: Domestic Energy Producers
populations.description: Companies and workers involved in producing affordable, reliable, and dispatchable domestic energy sources such as fossil fuel and nuclear energy.

populations.name: Green Energy Industry
populations.description: Businesses, workers, and investors in the wind, solar, and other renewable energy sectors that may lose government financial support and face regulatory disadvantages.

populations.name: Domestic Tourists
populations.description: United States residents who visit and benefit from affordable access and improved services to national parks and federal recreational lands.

populations.name: National Park Visitors
populations.description: Individuals who use and enjoy national parks, including tourists (both domestic and international) and outdoor recreation enthusiasts.

populations.name: Foreign Tourists
populations.description: Nonresident visitors to U.S. national parks who will face increased entrance and pass fees and potentially more restrictive access rules.

populations.name: Terrorist Organizations
populations.description: Groups designated as terrorist organizations that are restricted or targeted by sanctions and counterterrorism measures.

populations.name: Military Veterans
populations.description: Individuals who have served in the United States Armed Forces and are eligible for veterans benefits and services.

populations.name: Average Americans
populations.description: General public who may have been unfairly subject to criminal liability for unintentional regulatory violations.

populations.name: Religious Communities
populations.description: Groups and individuals engaged in religious practice and institutions that benefit from legal protections of religious freedom.

populations.name: Religious Liberty Opponents
populations.description: Individuals or groups who view expanded religious liberty protections as conflicting with civil rights, nondiscrimination policies, or secular governance.

populations.name: Secular Public Institutions
populations.description: Public schools, government programs, or agencies that may face challenges due to expanded religious exercise claims or conscience protections.

populations.name: Public Broadcasting Organizations
populations.description: Nonprofit media entities such as NPR and PBS that rely on federal funding and provide public broadcasting services.

populations.name: Public Broadcasting Employees
populations.description: Individuals employed by NPR, PBS, and other public broadcasting entities who may face job insecurity or funding cuts due to the order.

populations.name: Public Broadcasting Audiences
populations.description: Members of the public who rely on NPR, PBS, and related public broadcasting services for news and information and may lose access or experience reduced quality.

populations.name: State And Local Law Enforcement
populations.description: Police officers and agencies at the state and local level who will receive increased resources, legal protections, and training.

populations.name: Communities Affected By Police Aggression
populations.description: Community members who may experience increased aggressive policing, reduced civil rights protections, or discrimination under relaxed law enforcement restrictions.

populations.name: Individuals Impacted By Race And Equity Policy Restrictions
populations.description: Persons who may be negatively affected by the order's opposition to race- and sex-based equity or diversity policies in law enforcement.

populations.name: Truck Drivers
populations.description: Professional commercial motor vehicle operators who are directly affected by regulations regarding language proficiency and licensing.

populations.name: Non English Proficient Drivers
populations.description: Truck drivers who lack sufficient English language skills and may face job loss or disqualification under stricter enforcement.

populations.name: Immigrant Drivers
populations.description: Drivers who might be disproportionately impacted by stricter enforcement of English proficiency and licensing verification, particularly if they are non-native English speakers or hold foreign credentials.

populations.name: Hbcu Students
populations.description: Students attending Historically Black Colleges and Universities who benefit from improved educational programs, funding, and opportunities.

populations.name: Hbcu Administrators And Faculty
populations.description: Leaders, administrators, and instructors at HBCUs who gain from enhanced institutional support and partnerships.

populations.name: Foreign Funded Institutions
populations.description: American universities and colleges receiving foreign funding who may face increased compliance burdens, public scrutiny, and potential penalties.

populations.name: Commercial Fishermen
populations.description: Workers and businesses involved in commercial fishing, aquaculture, and fish processing benefiting from eased regulations and expanded opportunities.

populations.name: Seafood Industry
populations.description: Companies and workers in the seafood supply chain including production, processing, marketing, and export sectors gaining from enhanced competitiveness and trade support.

populations.name: Foreign Seafood Exporters
populations.description: Foreign seafood producers who may face increased trade restrictions and enforcement actions limiting market access in the U.S.

populations.name: Seniors
populations.description: Older adults, particularly those covered by Medicare, who benefit from reduced drug costs and improved coverage.

populations.name: Low Income Patients
populations.description: Individuals with limited income who may gain better access to affordable insulin, epinephrine, and other medications.

populations.name: Medicare Part D Insurance Companies
populations.description: Insurance providers offering Medicare Part D plans who may face lower premiums but also potential revenue losses and regulatory challenges.

populations.name: Medical Patients
populations.description: Individuals receiving medical care, treatment, or health services from healthcare providers and institutions.

populations.name: Critical Minerals Industry
populations.description: Workers and companies involved in the processing, refining, and manufacturing of critical minerals and their derivative products within the United States.

populations.name: Foreign Processors Of Critical Minerals
populations.description: Foreign companies and countries that currently dominate the processing of critical minerals who may lose market share or face trade restrictions as a result of this order.

populations.name: Law Firm Employees
populations.description: Individuals employed by law firms targeted for restricted government contract eligibility and security clearance limitations.

populations.name: Department of Justice
populations.description: The federal executive department responsible for law enforcement, legal affairs, and the administration of justice.

populations.name: Postal Carriers
populations.description: Companies and workers involved in transporting international postal shipments who face new duty collection, bonding, and reporting requirements.

populations.name: Large Investors
populations.description: Domestic and foreign investors and companies making substantial investments (above $1 billion) in the United States.

populations.name: Live Entertainment Artists
populations.description: Performers and artists in the live entertainment industry who benefit from fairer ticketing practices and better compensation.

populations.name: Concertgoers
populations.description: Members of the general public who attend live entertainment events and benefit from reduced ticket prices and increased access.

populations.name: Ticketing Agencies
populations.description: Companies that sell and distribute tickets to live events who may face increased regulatory scrutiny and enforcement actions.

populations.name: Ticket Scalpers
populations.description: Individuals or entities engaged in buying tickets for resale at marked-up prices through unfair or illegal means, who are targeted by enforcement efforts.

populations.name: Non Citizen Voters
populations.description: Individuals who are not U.S. citizens but may currently be registered to vote or attempt to vote illegally.

populations.name: Unbanked And Underbanked Populations
populations.description: Individuals who lack access to traditional banking or electronic payment systems and might face difficulties during transition from paper to electronic payments.

populations.name: Countries Importing Venezuelan Oil
populations.description: Countries whose goods face punitive tariffs under this order for importing Venezuelan oil, potentially negatively impacting their economies and trade relations.

populations.name: Parents Of Public School Students
populations.description: Parents and guardians of children attending public schools who may be affected by shifts in federal education policy and funding.

populations.name: Students In Federally Funded Schools
populations.description: Students attending schools that receive federal funding who may experience changes in education quality and access to programs.

populations.name: Diverse Student Populations
populations.description: Students from minority, marginalized, or underrepresented groups who could lose protections and benefits provided under current diversity and inclusion programs.

populations.name: State And Local Governments
populations.description: Government authorities at the state and local level responsible for infrastructure, emergency preparedness, and citizen safety.

populations.name: Citizens In Affected Communities
populations.description: Individuals and communities who benefit from improved infrastructure resilience and disaster preparedness measures.

populations.name: Public Service Workers
populations.description: Individuals employed in public service organizations who may lose eligibility for loan forgiveness due to the redefined scope of eligible employers.

populations.name: Nonprofit Organizations
populations.description: Nonprofit entities that may be excluded from the PSLF program if deemed to engage in activities with a substantial illegal purpose.

populations.name: Wildlife And Fish Habitats
populations.description: Ecosystems and animal populations that may be harmed by expanded timber harvesting and reduced environmental protections.

populations.name: English Proficient Citizens
populations.description: U.S. citizens and residents who speak English fluently and may benefit from increased use of English in government and society.

populations.name: Limited English Proficiency Populations
populations.description: Individuals, including immigrants and non-native speakers, who have limited English skills and may face challenges accessing government services or opportunities.

populations.name: Foreign Timber And Lumber Exporters
populations.description: Foreign companies and countries exporting timber, lumber, and derivative wood products to the United States who may face trade restrictions or tariffs as a result of this order.

populations.name: Individuals Facing Infertility
populations.description: Men and women experiencing fertility challenges who stand to benefit from improved access to IVF and more affordable treatment options.

populations.name: Independent Regulatory Agencies
populations.description: Regulatory bodies that operate with a degree of independence from presidential control, which may lose autonomy and face greater executive oversight due to this order.

populations.name: American Businesses
populations.description: U.S. companies that may benefit from reduced enforcement barriers to international commerce.

populations.name: Afrikaner Refugees
populations.description: Ethnic minority Afrikaner individuals fleeing racial discrimination and land expropriation in South Africa who may receive humanitarian relief and resettlement support.

populations.name: South African Government
populations.description: The government of South Africa, which is impacted by U.S. aid restrictions and diplomatic sanctions due to its policies and actions described in the order.

populations.name: Afrikaners In South Africa
populations.description: Ethnic minority Afrikaners living in South Africa who are subjected to discriminatory laws and practices, as well as potential economic and social dislocation.

populations.name: International Jurisdictional Subjects
populations.description: Individuals or officials from countries subject to ICC jurisdiction or investigations who may face sanctions, restrictions, or diplomatic repercussions due to this order.

populations.name: Female Athletes
populations.description: Women and girls who participate in sports and are intended beneficiaries of protections ensuring fair and safe competition.

populations.name: Transgender Athletes
populations.description: Individuals identifying as transgender who may be restricted or excluded from participation in womenâ€™s sports under sex-based eligibility rules.

populations.name: Legal Immigrants
populations.description: Individuals who have entered or remain in the United States through authorized immigration channels and hold valid visas or permanent residency.

populations.name: Mexico
populations.description: The nation of Mexico and its population, industries, and government affected by U.S. trade, immigration, and foreign policy.

populations.name: Canada
populations.description: The nation of Canada and its population, industries, and government affected by U.S. trade and foreign policy.

populations.name: Low Income Working Families
populations.description: Families with low income who are working and may gain educational choices and support from expanded scholarship and block grant usage.

populations.name: Military Connected Families
populations.description: Families affiliated with military personnel who may have new options for schooling through Department of Defense funding mechanisms.

populations.name: Native American Students
populations.description: Students eligible for Bureau of Indian Education schools who may access alternative educational options and federal funding.

populations.name: Students Impacted By Ideological Restrictions
populations.description: Students who may lose access to curriculum and programs addressing issues of race, gender identity, and equity due to policies prohibiting certain ideological teachings.

populations.name: Jewish Americans
populations.description: Americans of Jewish faith or heritage who may be affected by policies related to religious liberty, civil rights, and antisemitism.

populations.name: Minors With Gender Dysphoria
populations.description: Individuals under 19 experiencing gender dysphoria or related identity issues who seek medical treatment.

populations.name: Healthcare Providers Pediatric Transgender Care
populations.description: Medical professionals and institutions providing gender-affirming care or treatments to minors.

populations.name: Parents Supporting Gender Affirming Care
populations.description: Parents or guardians who seek or support gender-affirming medical treatment for their children.

populations.name: Armed Forces Personnel
populations.description: Active duty military members and civilian employees within the Department of Defense and related armed services.

populations.name: Minority Service Members
populations.description: Military personnel from racial, ethnic, or gender minority groups who may lose protections or support from DEI initiatives.

populations.name: Reproductive Rights Advocates
populations.description: Individuals and organizations that support access to abortion and reproductive health services who may see reduced federal support and increased restrictions.

populations.name: Women Seeking Elective Abortions
populations.description: Women and pregnant persons seeking elective abortion services who may face reduced access due to funding restrictions.

populations.name: Federal Contractors
populations.description: Companies and individuals that provide goods, services, or labor to the federal government under contract.

populations.name: Alaskan Native Communities
populations.description: Indigenous peoples of Alaska who have cultural and historical ties to geographic names and places affected by the renaming decisions.

populations.name: Federal Death Row Inmates
populations.description: Individuals sentenced to death at the federal level who face heightened enforcement and stricter incarceration conditions.

populations.name: Refugees
populations.description: Individuals seeking asylum or admission to the United States under refugee programs who are directly affected by suspension or restrictions.

populations.name: Children Born To Unauthorized Immigrants
populations.description: Children born in the U.S. to mothers who are unlawfully or temporarily present and fathers who are not citizens or lawful permanent residents, who may be denied automatic citizenship and related documentation.

populations.name: Removable Aliens
populations.description: Individuals unlawfully present in the United States who are subject to removal under immigration law enforcement policies.

populations.name: Sanctuary Jurisdictions
populations.description: State or local governments that limit cooperation with federal immigration enforcement and may face funding restrictions or sanctions.

populations.name: Indigenous Communities
populations.description: Alaska Native peoples and local indigenous populations who may face cultural, environmental, and land use impacts from accelerated resource development.

populations.name: Federal Grantees
populations.description: Organizations and individuals that receive federal grant funding for research, programs, or services.

populations.name: Social Media Platforms
populations.description: Companies and platforms that moderate online content and may face restrictions or reduced coordination with federal government efforts to regulate misinformation or disinformation.

populations.name: Rural Communities
populations.description: Residents, businesses, and local governments in rural and non-metropolitan areas of the United States.

populations.name: Americorps Alumni
populations.description: Individuals who have completed AmeriCorps national service terms and are eligible for federal competitive service appointments under this order.

populations.name: Affected Western Balkans Individuals
populations.description: Individuals and entities in the Western Balkans subject to sanctions and restrictions due to alleged destabilizing activities, corruption, or abuses.

populations.name: Students And Educators
populations.description: Students and school staff including teachers and administrators who benefit from improved safety measures and trauma-informed active-shooter drills.

populations.name: Illegal Firearms Manufacturers And Traffickers
populations.description: Individuals and groups involved in illicit manufacturing and distribution of unserialized or illegal firearms and conversion devices who face increased enforcement.

populations.name: American Workers
populations.description: Workers nationwide who benefit from strong labor protections, family-sustaining wages, and equitable job opportunities promoted by this order.

populations.name: Underserved Communities
populations.description: Populations and geographic communities historically denied equitable economic and social opportunities who will benefit from targeted workforce development and anti-discrimination measures.

populations.name: Hispanic And Latino Students
populations.description: Hispanic and Latino undergraduate and graduate students who attend Hispanic-Serving Institutions and benefit from expanded educational support and economic opportunities.

populations.name: Hispanic Serving Institutions
populations.description: Colleges and universities with at least 25% Hispanic undergraduate enrollment that serve predominantly Hispanic and Latino student bodies and receive enhanced federal resources under this order.

populations.name: Women And Girls
populations.description: Female and girl populations of all backgrounds whose historical contributions and stories this order seeks to recognize and honor.

populations.name: Diverse Historical Communities
populations.description: Groups representing varied racial, ethnic, cultural, and social backgrounds whose histories intersect with women's contributions and are intended to have increased representation in historic recognition.

populations.name: Women Of Color
populations.description: Women from racial and ethnic minority groups who have historically been underrepresented in biomedical research and face unique health disparities.

populations.name: Women With Disabilities
populations.description: Women living with disabilities who often face greater barriers to adequate healthcare and are underrepresented in health research.

populations.name: Older Women
populations.description: Women in midlife and later years, particularly those experiencing menopause and related health conditions, who benefit from focused research and healthcare improvements.

populations.name: Us Persons With Sensitive Data
populations.description: United States individuals whose sensitive personal or government-related data is protected by the order, including federal employees and contractors.

populations.name: Data Brokerage Industry
populations.description: Companies and entities involved in collecting, aggregating, and selling bulk sensitive personal data which may face increased regulation and restrictions.

populations.name: Foreign Entities In Countries Of Concern
populations.description: Foreign companies, governments, or individuals in designated countries of concern that may lose access to sensitive U.S. data and face restrictions or monitoring.

populations.name: Coast Guard Personnel
populations.description: Coast Guard officers and staff responsible for enforcing maritime security regulations and conducting inspections, searches, and access control under these amended rules.

populations.name: Maritime Industry Workers
populations.description: Individuals working in shipping, port operations, and waterfront facilities who benefit from enhanced security measures protecting their workplaces and vessels.

populations.name: Innocent Civilian Populations In West Bank And Region
populations.description: Civilians residing in the West Bank and surrounding Middle East region who benefit indirectly from increased peace and security resulting from the sanctions and enforcement actions.

populations.name: Sanctioned Persons And Affiliates
populations.description: Individuals and entities targeted by sanctions under the order who face financial restrictions, asset freezes, travel bans, and legal penalties.

populations.name: Competing Research Areas
populations.description: Research fields or projects that may receive less funding or attention due to the reallocation of resources towards women's health research.

populations.name: Federal Budget Stakeholders
populations.description: Taxpayers, government budget officers, and agencies who may be negatively affected by increased payroll costs and budget reallocations resulting from adjusted pay rates.

populations.name: Non Union Workers
populations.description: Workers employed in sectors or projects who are not unionized and who may face reduced job opportunities or competitive disadvantage due to increased preference for union labor.

populations.name: Non Hispanic Serving Institutions
populations.description: Colleges and universities that are not designated as Hispanic-Serving Institutions and may face comparatively less federal focus and resources as priorities shift towards HSIs.

populations.name: Tribal Nations
populations.description: Federally recognized Indian tribes and other Tribal Nations that are recipients of federal funding and subject to trust and treaty responsibilities.

populations.name: Non Tribal Federal Funding Recipients
populations.description: Non-Tribal entities competing for federal funding which may face reduced access or increased competition due to prioritization of Tribal Nations.

populations.name: Small Federal Contractors
populations.description: Smaller contracting companies that may face increased regulatory and compliance costs due to enhanced security standards and interagency requirements.

populations.name: Asian Americans And Nhpi Communities
populations.description: Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander communities targeted for increased federal equity, justice, and opportunity initiatives.

populations.name: Federal Agencies With Increased Administrative Burden
populations.description: Federal departments and agencies required to continue managing numerous advisory committees and implement expanded reporting, which may strain resources and capacity.

populations.name: Hazardous Materials Responders
populations.description: Emergency personnel and workers involved in responding to hazardous material incidents who receive federal support and resources.

populations.name: Affected Residents
populations.description: Individuals and families living in or near the communities impacted by industrial chemical releases and cleanup operations.

populations.name: Industrial Transport Companies
populations.description: Companies involved in rail and hazardous material transportation that face increased regulatory scrutiny, liability, and potential financial burdens.

populations.name: Local Businesses
populations.description: Small and medium-sized businesses in affected areas that may encounter economic disruption due to the incident and prolonged recovery efforts.

populations.name: Coast Guard Officers
populations.description: Commissioned officers of the U.S. Coast Guard subject to appointment, promotion, removal, and retirement determinations delegated by the order.

populations.name: Foreign Investors In Countries Of Concern
populations.description: Foreign individuals, entities, and governments in the designated countries of concern that may face restricted access to U.S. investments and technology due to enhanced regulatory controls.

populations.name: Foreign Manufacturers
populations.description: Foreign companies and workers who may lose market opportunities due to increased U.S. domestic manufacturing preferences and procurement rules.

populations.name: Selected Reserve And Irr Members
populations.description: Reservists and Individual Ready Reserve members who may face activation and deployment, impacting their civilian life and employment.

populations.name: Women Seeking Contraception
populations.description: Women and individuals of reproductive age seeking affordable and accessible contraception and family planning services.

populations.name: Private Health Insurers
populations.description: Insurance companies that may face increased regulatory and compliance costs due to expanded contraceptive coverage mandates and privacy protections.

populations.name: States With Restrictive Policies
populations.description: State governments and officials who have enacted or maintain restrictive abortion or reproductive health policies that may conflict with federal efforts and face political or legal challenges.

populations.name: Private Sector Employers
populations.description: Non-federal employers who may face increased competition or challenges in hiring military spouses as some opt for federal employment opportunities.

populations.name: Non Military Spouse Job Seekers
populations.description: General job seekers who may experience indirect disadvantages as federal hiring authorities and resources prioritize military-connected spouses.

populations.name: Public Health Workers
populations.description: Healthcare practitioners and public health officials who may face higher exposure risks or face new operational challenges due to the removal of vaccination mandates.

populations.name: Family Caregivers
populations.description: Individuals providing informal, often unpaid care to family members including older adults, people with disabilities, and wounded service members.

populations.name: Care Workforce
populations.description: Individuals employed in child care and long-term care professions whose jobs and working conditions are directly impacted by the orderâ€™s provisions.

populations.name: Regulated Entities
populations.description: Businesses, organizations, and individuals subject to federal regulatory review who may face increased compliance costs and procedural requirements from updated regulatory processes.

populations.name: Commercial Spyware Vendors
populations.description: Companies and entities that develop, market, or sell commercial spyware products potentially subject to prohibitions, restrictions, and enhanced due diligence under this order.

populations.name: Foreign Suppliers
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as foreign suppliers who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Paper Straw Manufacturers
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as paper straw manufacturers who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Law Firm Clients
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as law firm clients who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Non Hbcu Academic Institutions
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as non hbcu academic institutions who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Civilians Populations In Designated Countries
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as civilians populations in designated countries who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Criminal Organizations
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as criminal organizations who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Non Federal Employees
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as non federal employees who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: None
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as none who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Persons With Disabilities
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as persons with disabilities who may be affected by federal policies.

populations.name: Essential Workers
populations.description: Individuals, organizations, or entities categorized as essential workers who may be affected by federal policies.
